prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Tapered Middle Section Start by creating a new coordinate system for the first part. The euler angles for this system should be set to [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector should be [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. This will ensure the correct orientation for the part. Next, create the 2D sketch for this part on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch should consist of a single face with a closed loop. The loop for this part consists of 8 line segments with the following start and end points (in meters): * Line 1: [0.0, 0.3] to [0.0, 0.75] * Line 2: [0.0, 0.75] to [0.45, 0.75] * Line 3: [0.45, 0.75] to [0.45, 0.3] * Line 4: [0.45, 0.3] to [0.267, 0.3] * Line 5: [0.267, 0.3] to [0.267, 0.0] * Line 6: [0.267, 0.0] to [0.183, 0.0] * Line 7: [0.183, 0.0] to [0.183, 0.3] * Line 8: [0.183, 0.3] to [0.0, 0.3] After creating the loop, use the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system to transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch. Next, extrude the 2D sketch to create the 3D model for the first part. The extrude depth towards the normal should be set to 0.03 meters and the sketch scale should be set to 0.75. The extrude depth opposite normal should be set to 0 to ensure that the extrusion only occurs in the normal direction. The boolean operation for the first part should be set to "Create a new solid body". This will ensure that the first part is combined with any subsequent parts according to their defined boolean operations. The description for the first part should be as follows: * Shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The top and bottom sections are parallel to each other, while the middle section is perpendicular to both. The object is centered on a white background. * Length: 0.03 meters * Width: 0.75 meters * Height: 0.75 meters</description>
